summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Interlochen Center for the Arts, demanding student records for specific students as part of a federal criminal investigation into violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 2423(a) and 1591 (related to sex trafficking and transportation of minors). It includes a cover letter requesting confidentiality and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and cover letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Jocks
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to him as the contact for Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Interlochen Center for the Arts to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, 4000 Highway M-137, Interlochen, MI 49643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an ongoing federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 2423(a) and 1591, which relate to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity and sex trafficking.
The U.S. Attorney's Office specifically requested Interlochen Center for Arts to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The subpoena demands all student records for specific, unnamed students who attended Interlochen Arts Camp and/or Interlochen Arts Academy.
The document indicates the investigation was active as of March 2021, focusing on obtaining records from an educational institution associated with arts training for youth.
